content.description:
Start on the backside of the tower from the road

Follow a left leaning weakness placing decent pro until you gain a ledge.  Face climb past three bolts and scramble the last 10' to anchors.

Rap the opposite side of the tower, facing the road.

Fun Tower right off the road.

Anyone with FA information please postup.
content.location: This route and tower is on the west side of the road about a half mile north of Outhouse Tower.

climbs.name: West Face of Tiki Tower
climbs.fa: Autumn, 1991 by Doug Fuller, Peter Lenz

content.description:
This "tower," is really just a large boulder, but the route is fun.

Climb chimney (5.6 a bit loose) to bolted face (solid). Rappel from chains on summit.

There are 3 other (top rope) routes; they are on the other faces.

You can discover them for yourself. I suggest no further bolting (other than to replace or add  bolts as needed on the West face route) on this formation, given the small size of the tower, and the fact that the other routes can be easily tope roped from the existing anchors.
content.location: 3.5 miles down Buckhorn wash, look to the West. Tiki Tower looks like a brown banana in the floor of the basin. West Face of Tiki Tower. Start in obvious chimney/crack. Move onto bolted face halfway up. Rappel from chains on summit.
